intro: Sarcanthopsis warocqueana, commonly known as the Warocquean starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that contribute to its ornamental appeal. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in moist, temperate climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
